issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
*_Update_*
This issue is only happening while running Eucalyptus on CentOS 6u7. Tested on CentOS 7.2, couldn't reproduce.

*Symptoms*
Volume attachment fails, and goes from _attaching_ to _available_ on CLC.

*How reproducible*
Always

*Steps to reproduce*
a. Set up a cloud on CentOS 6u7 with DAS as blockstorage manager.
b. Run an instance
c. Create and attach a volume to the instance

*nc.log*
{code}
2016-10-10 11:27:08  INFO 000015459 doAttachVolume           | [i-8b8e7a1c][vol-27ca1e4b] attaching volume
2016-10-10 11:27:08 DEBUG 000015459 doAttachVolume           | [i-8b8e7a1c][vol-27ca1e4b] volume attaching (remoteDev=sc://vol-27ca1e4b,ugqq6uYkWwwWrmD5VcMJ6gHH1+jvwYulCV6yLyubU0i+p9V0kCXgwhPdFBZ03lspVItn+w

2016-10-10 11:27:09 DEBUG 000015459 scClientCall             |  done scOps=ExportVolume clientrc=0 opFail=0
2016-10-10 11:27:09 DEBUG 000015459 connect_iscsi_target     | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl /,vol-27ca1e4b,vdc,euca-vol-27ca1e4b-dev-vdc,virtio,
eucalyptus,/etc/ceph/ceph.client.eucalyptus.keyring,/etc/ceph/ceph.conf,iscsi,tgt,,,,aFX2Y2BlpXRPxFa6ZXTSO2e05dUORVpsG+S+fJIBnnqYds3W/jI953leMbGmO4KXC8UmF2VpQ1JrDqskZ0W/2bCfKT8gnhEdtLfQnBEPV1BqCXvLETj2g4ly/
RVa+uEb23g1g6zhu2VoU1xc8OZS/bd/8tMLIgmGLJWxMEplj/aBawz5OWmsy7q+vgYzfHLlAZkF18PlJwra7ytnyOa+x+hVVkloFqmziLeYACKteOmjQ+qTd27rpmlbPIrxsUGB3TAWeeq1cPE/0XoY0MCJmMKmA+5ac8oqzPPGFpl+zrimI5Lnsn6sZLBzUQXJHZJlI14OUAy
f8UABx+Nag0FD2g==,,10.111.5.162,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store2`
2016-10-10 11:27:09 DEBUG 000015459 connect_iscsi_target     | connect script returned: 29, stdout: '', stderr: 'Before connecting:
Can't locate object method "autoflush" via package "IO::Handle" at /usr/share/eucalyptus/iscsitarget_common.pl line 104.
Compilation failed in require at //usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl line 77.

Volume are failing to attach in certain QA runs...

EDGE DAS:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8080/view/All/job/nephoria-legacy-ebs-suite/1578/console
VPC DAS:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8080/view/All/job/nephoria-legacy-ebs-suite/1577/console
fields.summary: EBS Failures - Volumes fail to attach

comments.body: I'll take a look. I did lots of attaching/detaching as part of my upgrade testing, including on CentOS6u7 with Euca 4.2.2 and 4.3.0. Maybe something changed recently?

[~lincoln.thomas], what version of eucalyptus are you testing on CentOS 6u7?

EDIT: should be a question for [~mclark]

[~sjones] [~lincoln.thomas] it looks like the test(s) were running against maint-4.3...
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8080/job/Quick%20Launch/6251/
[~mclark], Eucalyptus 4.3 is not supported on CentOS 6.x. to the best of my knowledge.

[~lincoln.thomas] [~vasya] ,
Could this potentially affect portions of the 4.3 migration and/or upgrade process on systems prior to the OS upgrade?
https://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.3.0/#install-guide/rhel7_upgrade_euca_before_os.html
Thanks,
-M

[~shaon] said he was testing with security-4.3, that's what I launched. But Calyptos failed to deploy for an unrelated reason that will be discussed elsewhere, see http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos-CI/746/console , from http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.3/77/

[~lincoln.thomas], I have updated the Calyptos job in Jenkins, and rebuilt your job,
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.3/78/

Feel free to use it and free them when you are done.

Now that Calyptos is deploying correctly: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.3/79/

I believe the initial "can't find the target" messages are OK, it's just making sure target 1 does not already exist before it creates it.

After appearing to succeed, it immediately unbinds and deletes the export of the volume, probably because of this in the nc.log:

{noformat}
2016-10-10 17:18:18  INFO | [i-9ff87852][vol-f3bb9321] attaching volume
2016-10-10 17:18:19 ERROR | Failed to connect to EBS target: iscsi,tgt,,,,,,10.111.1.135,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store1
2016-10-10 17:18:19 ERROR | [vol-f3bb9321] failed to disconnect iscsi target
2016-10-10 17:18:19 ERROR | Error connecting ebs volume sc://vol-f3bb9321,
2016-10-10 17:18:19 ERROR | [i-9ff87852][vol-f3bb9321] failed error=1
{noformat}

But the NC doesn't say why it failed.

The sosreport is saved at g-19-11:/root

On DEBUG mode, I see that same things as in the Description of this bug:

{noformat}
2016-10-11 14:45:04 DEBUG 000014315 connect_iscsi_target     | invoking `//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl /,vol-f3bb9321,vdc,euca-vol-f3bb9321-dev-vdc,virtio,eucalyptus,/etc/ceph/ceph.client.eucalyptus.keyring,/etc/ceph/ceph.conf,iscsi,tgt,,,,,,10.111.1.135,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store2`
2016-10-11 14:45:04 DEBUG 000014315 connect_iscsi_target     | connect script returned: 29, stdout: '', stderr: 'Before connecting:
Can't locate object method "autoflush" via package "IO::Handle" at /usr/share/eucalyptus/iscsitarget_common.pl line 104.
Compilation failed in require at //usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl line 77.
'
{noformat}

Perhaps new code is using a library that exists on RHEL7 that doesn't exist in RHEL6?
Fix in 7d2fcd29cce9c986c35c47316aaee03550c78825. Fix merged only into 4.3.x branches

Verified.  I was able to attach a volume to a running instance-store instance without issues.
{code}
[root@c-34 ~]# rpm -qi eucalyptus
Name        : eucalyptus                   Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.3.1                             Vendor: Hewlett Packard Enterprise
Release     : 0.25135.61.20161031git2ca359f.el6   Build Date: Mon 31 Oct 2016 03:17:22 PM PDT
Install Date: Tue 01 Nov 2016 10:07:43 AM PDT      Build Host: buildsys.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Group       : Applications/System           Source RPM: eucalyptus-4.3.1-0.25135.61.20161031git2ca359f.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 272850                           License: GPLv3
Signature   : (none)
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
Summary     : Eucalyptus cloud platform
Description :
Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.
{code}
